QUESTION 54) The Rio de Janeiro's retail trading clerks were among the first categories of workers to organize in associations and to demand the intervention of public authorities in the mediation of their rights struggles. In the 1880s, the clerks participated in the political arena and won the streets with several others, such as Republicans and abolitionists.
Popinigis, F. “All freedoms are sisters”: the clerks and the workers' struggles for the performance of the workers mentioned in the text represented, in the capital of the Empire, a moment of
A) Maintenance of employers rules.
B) detachment from liberal ideas.
C) Strengthening of labor contracts.
D) Consolidation of union structures.
E) Contestation of monarchical principles.
